Property.preferredDefinition: A chronic disorder marked by hardening and thickening of the skin.  Scleroderma can be localized or it can affect the entire body (systemic).:Function; what something is used for.:Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function.

Concepts.definition: A localized or systemic chronic and progressive autoimmune disorder characterized by thickening of the skin and the connective tissues. Localized scleroderma affects only the skin. Systemic scleroderma affects internal organs, including the heart, lungs, gastrointestinal tract, and kidneys.
The normal action performed by a structure or device.
Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Self-administered questions t
ReferenceDocuments.description: Self-administered questions to determine the extent of functional impairment in the past seven days in respondents with scleroderma.
